_header: O ye princess that pricked has my heart
_description: A love lyric on the unkindness of his mistress — one stanza rhyme royal

Lam432.First Lines:
O ye [pay…id] in my presens þat prechyd hase my
                        hertwith yowr wofull wordys and yowr
                    wamytation…
Lam432.Last Lines:
…Þis I wyll þat ye wyt wher someuer ye beeI luffe
                    yow meche bettyr [þan?] ye do mee
Lam432.Note:
Paper flyleaf foxed, ink very faded; P. J. Frankis transcribed this item
                    with the help of UV light in 1953 and his transcription is tucked into the MS.
                    He could not distinguish the third word either.
Lam432.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “A Late-Fifteenth Century Love Lyric.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         69 (1954): 153-60: 553.
